header_summary:
SeedHammer is developing a new standard for metal engraved backups using a compact output descriptor based on the PSBT binary encoding, specifically the BIP174 PSBT format's PSBT_GLOBAL_XPUB feature. The textual encoding adheres to BIPs 380-386 and BIP 389, integrating wallet-policies and Miniscript with some limitations, and includes additional metadata such as labels and birthdates.

The community has debated the choice of encoding between CBOR and PSBT, with Blockchain Commons advocating for CBOR, while SeedHammer supports PSBT for its simplicity and existing wallet software compatibility. Discussions also include considerations on whether to create a distinct header and magic number for the new format or to extend the current PSBT format.

Seeking community feedback, SeedHammer has made available a set of resources for the proposed standard, which are open for review and experimentation via the following links: [proposal], [implementation], and [playground], prior to commencing the formal BIP process.

active_posts.summary:
- Ordinals track satoshis, enabling NFT creation without on-chain inscription data.
- Off-chain transfer of NFT ownership reduces costs and blockchain space usage.
- Liquid's model may outperform ordinals for value-fluctuating semi-fungible tokens.

active_posts.title: HTLC output aggregation as a mitigation for tx recycling, jamming, and on-chain efficiency (covenants)
active_posts.summary:
- HTLC output aggregation combines all HTLCs into a single transaction output to improve chain efficiency.
- Aggregated outputs reduce the risk of jamming and recycling, but demand new covenant primitives for full adoption.
- A proof-of-concept using OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY demonstrates aggregation with a merkle tree for claiming HTLCs.

active_posts.title: HTLC output aggregation as a mitigation for tx recycling, jamming, and on-chain efficiency (covenants)
active_posts.summary:
- HTLC output aggregation could enhance efficiency and secure transaction outputs using covenants.
